frame.name: Organization
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame describes intentionally formed human social groups (here termed <fen>Organization</fen>s) with some definite structure and <fen>Members</fen>. They may be relatively informal, consisting only of a group of individuals who are aware of who is and who is not a fellow member, or they may be complex and long-lasting, such as the Roman Catholic Church or the Conservative Party.
</def-root>

FE.name: Organization
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity of which the individuals are <fen>Members</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which an <fen>Organization</fen> is formed.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>A name given to the <fen>Organization</fen> for identification.</def-root>

FE.name: Container_possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location or political locale that the <fen>Organization</fen> is contained within.
<ex>Or, if you want to work on women's human rights issues, work for a <fex name="con">Canadian</fex> <t>organization</t> that advocates on behalf of women.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the general location where the <fen>Organization</fen> operates, but does not indicate the possessor of the <fen>Organization</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Organization</fen> not covered by a more specific frame element.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: cartel.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an organization of producers (and sometimes middlemen) intended to control commerce in some commodity for the benefit of the members.

lexUnit.name: club.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A voluntary social organization created for the benefit of its members; clubs may be informal, or large and highly organized.

lexUnit.name: government.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the governing body of a state

lexUnit.name: organization.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an organized body of people with a particular purpose, such as a business or government department.

lexUnit.name: association.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a group of people organized for a joint purpose.

lexUnit.name: league.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a collection of people, countries, or groups that combine for mutual protection or cooperation.

lexUnit.name: intelligence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an organization devoted to the collection of information.

lexUnit.name: agency.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a government office or department providing a specific service for a state.

lexUnit.name: union.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a club, society, or association formed by people with a common interest or purpose.

lexUnit.name: brotherhood.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a fraternity of men joined by like interests

lexUnit.name: delegation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: An group of individuals meeting in a group in representation of others.

lexUnit.name: committee.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A small group assembling to decide certain affairs or charge some endeavor.

lexUnit.name: group.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an organized set of individuals set upon some task
